intro: Combretum gillettianum, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its striking red or orange flowers that appear in clusters during the dry season. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often hairy and turn yellow before falling off. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
